cmdb.description: CMDB (Configuration Management Database) MCP server for querying configuration items, dependencies, and service maps. Read-only at all autonomy levels. Set the environment variables above before use.

notes.setup: 1. Set CMDB_PROVIDER to your CMDB tool (servicenow, device42, i-doit, custom). 2. Set CMDB_API_URL to the API endpoint. 3. Set CMDB_API_KEY to your read-only API key. 4. Ensure the API key has read-only permissions â€” CMDB modifications should only be made through the CMDB's native interface.

tool_descriptions.query_ci: Search for configuration items by name, type, IP address, or other attributes
tool_descriptions.get_dependencies: Get upstream and downstream dependencies for a configuration item
tool_descriptions.get_ci_details: Get detailed information about a specific CI (owner, criticality, environment, location, etc.)

notes.level_1_permissions: At Autonomy Level 1: All tools available (read-only).
notes.level_2_permissions: At Autonomy Level 2: All tools available (read-only).
notes.level_3_permissions: At Autonomy Level 3: All tools available (read-only).
notes.level_4_permissions: At Autonomy Level 4: All tools available (read-only).
notes.safety: CMDB access is READ-ONLY at all autonomy levels. The agent should never modify CMDB records. All CMDB updates must go through the organization's change management process.
